Topic.Title: EBAY DOES NOT PRTECT SELLERS USING INTERNATIONAL FIRST CLASS MAIL

Message.Msg: There is no tracking information for First-Class international mailing. You need to mail with Priority in order to get tracking information. That is how I always mail my internation packages.

Message.Title: "You really need to find some friends or just someone real to talk to I feel sorry for you now :-( You're all ALONE. . ."
Message.Msg: "....or just someone real to talk to......" That never has and never will happen "I feel sorry for you now :-( " Agreed. "You're all ALONE. . ." Searing truth. -Sully Rules

Topic.Title: EBAY DOES NOT PRTECT SELLERS USING INTERNATIONAL FIRST CLASS MAIL

Message.Msg: $36.75 for a 1 pound package via PMI versus $16.25 for FCIM. Cheapskate eBay buyers aren't going to go for that option. Not to mention, Priority doesn't track to the most troublesome countries such as Italy, France, Spain, Brazil, Russia.. Best bet is to not ever sell international. Look at any reputable seller and most all negs or neutrals come from international buyers. I said good riddance to these PITA's in January after the postage increase and not a single issue in over 6 months..

Topic.Title: EBAY DOES NOT PRTECT SELLERS USING INTERNATIONAL FIRST CLASS MAIL

Message.Msg: Best part is eBay cut a sweetheart deal with USPS so Chinese sellers can ship, with tracking for nearly the same price as domestic First Class. Now this isn't a two-way street where US sellers can also ship to China, it only works for the Chinese shipping to the US. Don't ya just love eBay and USPS ???

Topic.Title: Run up to earnings has started July 17, $56.50

Message.Msg: Not sure what's going on at eBay but so far, July has been my best month selling on eBay in nearly 2 years. I'm back to moving about 30 items per day, looking at $10K in sales this month. Just hope it stays this way but knowing eBay, they will find some way to screw things up.

Topic.Title: EBAY DOES NOT PRTECT SELLERS USING INTERNATIONAL FIRST CLASS MAIL

Message.Msg: Simple solution: Don't ship overseas Don't buy overseas

Topic.Title: EBAY DOES NOT PRTECT SELLERS USING INTERNATIONAL FIRST CLASS MAIL

Message.Msg: "Cheapskate eBay buyers aren't going to go for that option" If they want the item bad enough they will pay the postage. If not, no harm or foul.

Topic.Title: EBAY DOES NOT PRTECT SELLERS USING INTERNATIONAL FIRST CLASS MAIL

Message.Msg: If they are dumb enough to buying anything from China, then they get what they desrve.

Topic.Title: EBAY DOES NOT PRTECT SELLERS USING INTERNATIONAL FIRST CLASS MAIL

Message.Msg: Evidently someone's buying from the Chinese sellers but if you look at their feedback, far too many buyers complain about cheap quality. Is this good for eBay? In my opinion, it drives buyers away. Just one of the huge mistakes John Donahoe has made as CEO.
